comments_since_last_sample.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.
(EU) My car is a 2013 model. have the knob turned on automatically. If not, good ol' Waze app alerts me to do so if I am driving in an European type of road

Alas, when you have an older EV with little range left even at full charge, it is best to leave them off for as long as safely available when you know you'll be cutting it close. Unless absolutely necessary, I leave mine on auto.
I wish I read this LPT before getting into my car accident. Was driving home at midnight without headlights and got myself smacked into a pole by someone trying to make a left turn.

I was an engineer for Delco Electronics in the mid 90s, working on the body control modules. These are the black boxes that control headlight activation, among other things.  

In that capacity, I had all the access to GM's database of studies, as we were in the early days of implementing DRLs. Canada had already required DRLs at that time.  One Canadian study had determined that the  odds of being in an accident dropped by 50% if the driver had their headlights on.  

Regardless of fault, you're half as likely to be in an accident if you leave your lights on. Period.

The reason for this is that even in broad daylight, there's still a ton of dynamic range in the light environment. When you drive into the shade (tunnel, near trees around hills, etc) you become nearly invisible.  That's why it's important to run lights, ESPECIALLY on bright sunny days.

This notion that it diminishes our ability to notice emergency vehicles is myth. I drive fire apparatus and have been trained to do so.  Remember that *we* also need to see *you*, something that is more difficult when you do not have lights on.
Don't listen to that guy, I'm pretty sure he works for the lightbulb/LED industry and wants your headlights to break earlier. *puts on tinfoil hat*
Sounds like a driving tip which is not for this sub. Thanks in advance

Disagreed. I wish people would leave their lights off in ordinary daylight.

Not only are they a distraction from motorcycles, emergency vehicles, and other hazards, but daytime running lights have made people stupid because they don’t bother to turn on their headlights all the way because they see light in front of them; and now that dashboards are all fully illuminated, that doesn’t clue them in that their tail lights are out.

Apart from that, I tend to not favor things that encourage people to drop their situational awareness.
You had better not be one of those LED assholes.  I want to take a sledgehammer to those lights.
Or at least when you turn your wipers on you turn on your lights.
